parkInfo.name: Europa-Park
parkInfo.tagline: Europe's second most popular theme park resort
parkInfo.shortDescription: A leading European theme park and resort with themed areas representing different European countries and cultures.
parkInfo.longDescription: Europa-Park is Germany's largest theme park and Europe's second most visited theme park resort after Disneyland Paris. Located in Rust, Baden-Württemberg, it spans over 95 hectares and is divided into 19 themed areas, primarily representing European countries and their cultures. Founded in 1975 by the Mack family, who still own and operate it today, Europa-Park has grown from a showcase for Mack Rides' attractions to a world-class destination with over 100 attractions, including 13 roller coasters, water rides, dark rides, and family attractions. The park is known for its beautiful landscaping, high-quality theming, diverse entertainment offerings, and exceptional gastronomy with over 40 restaurants and bars. Europa-Park operates seasonally from late March to early January, with a special winter season featuring festive decorations and shows. The resort has expanded over the years to include multiple hotels, the Rulantica water park, and the Yullbe virtual reality experience, making it a complete vacation destination that attracts over 5.8 million visitors annually.

howToReach.byCar: Located near the A5 motorway, with direct connections from Karlsruhe, Freiburg, and Strasbourg. Free parking available.
howToReach.byPublicTransport: The nearest train stations are in Ringsheim and Freiburg, with shuttle services connecting to the park. Several bus lines also serve the park directly.
howToReach.byPlane: The closest airports are Strasbourg Airport (40km), EuroAirport Basel-Mulhouse-Freiburg (90km), and Frankfurt Airport (180km).

themedAreas.name: Germany

themedAreas.name: Spain

themedAreas.name: Russia
themedAreas.description: Home to the Euro-Mir spinning coaster and Russian-themed buildings.

themedAreas.name: Greece
themedAreas.description: Ancient Greek-themed area featuring Poseidon water coaster, Atlantis Adventure, and Pegasus.

themedAreas.name: Iceland

themedAreas.name: Adventure Land

hotels.name: Hotel Santa Isabel

additionalVenues.name: Rulantica
additionalVenues.description: A massive indoor/outdoor Nordic-themed water park with slides, wave pools, lazy rivers, and themed areas. Opened in 2019, it features 25 water attractions across 32,600 square meters.

additionalVenues.name: Yullbe
additionalVenues.description: A state-of-the-art virtual reality facility offering immersive adventures in custom-designed spaces with free-roaming VR technology.
additionalVenues.location: Next to the main entrance of Europa-Park

additionalVenues.name: Europa-Park Arena
additionalVenues.description: A multipurpose arena hosting concerts, shows, and events with a capacity of up to 6,000 people.

additionalVenues.name: Confertainment Center
additionalVenues.description: Conference and event space offering facilities for business meetings, product launches, and corporate events with a theme park backdrop.
additionalVenues.capacity: Up to 1,200 people in various configurations

history.founder: Franz Mack and his son Roland Mack

milestones.event: Europa-Park opens with just a few attractions and the Schloss Balthasar (castle) as its centerpiece
Introduction of the first themed country areas
Opening of the first hotel (El Andaluz)
Celebration of 20th anniversary with major expansions
Introduction of Silver Star, then Europe's tallest roller coaster
Opening of Wodan - Timburcoaster, the park's first wooden roller coaster
Opening of Rulantica water park and Hotel Krønasår
Completion of the rebuilt Pirates in Batavia attraction after the 2018 fire
Opening of Voltron Nevera coaster and Croatia themed area

history.ownershipInfo: Still owned and operated by the Mack family, who also own Mack Rides, a major manufacturer of amusement rides worldwide

statistics.economicImpact: Major contributor to the regional economy, generating over €850 million annually through direct and indirect spending
